parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (1324000), which is a strong indicator of electoral propaganda, as it's a mandatory identifier for campaign materials in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions the UDMR (Uniunea Democrată Maghiară din România) party and uses the hashtag #echipaudmrilfov, clearly referring to a specific parliamentary candidate or group of candidates from that party.  This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, this message is designed to reach a wide audience, not just a select few. The use of hashtags further suggests an attempt to reach a broader public. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The message's core argument ("Cetățeanul să nu mai fie sancționat prin impozitări care sfidează rațiunea. Statul să servească, nu să umilească!") directly appeals to voters' concerns and aims to garner support for the UDMR's platform.  The hashtags "#alegevocearațiunii" ("choose the voice of reason") and "#echipaudmrilfov" explicitly encourage voters to support the UDMR. This strongly suggests an electoral objective, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic reporting. It's a clear political statement advocating for a specific party's platform.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The statement is not a personal opinion; it's a political message promoting a specific party's policy position.  The use of the CMF number and party hashtags confirms this is not a personal expression.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3942630265974085</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific political party (UDMR), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has a clear electoral objective: to influence voters to support the UDMR. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's content is not journalistic in nature; it's a direct appeal for votes.  There are no counterarguments to suggest otherwise.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>UDMR</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>UDMR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ/UDMR, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 3942630265974085), cu un buget de sub 100 RON, care conține propagandă electorală pentru UDMR,  folosind hashtag-uri precum "#alegevocearațiunii" și "#echipaudmrilfov" și un număr CMF (1324000),  având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea UDMR.  Postarea, cu un mesaj direct ("Cetățeanul să nu mai fie sancționat prin impozitări care sfidează rațiunea. Statul să servească, nu să umilească!"),  se adresează publicului larg, depășind limitele jurnalismului și având ca obiectiv clar influențarea votului.  Postarea a atins o audiență estimată la peste 1 milion de persoane, conform datelor din Ad Library, cu informații de contact disponibile (demeterandras@rmdsz.ro, +40745600964, https://rmdsz.ro/).
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
